title: Asthma Predictive Index (API)
desc: The Asthma Predictive Index (API) determines likelihood of pediatric patients developing childhood asthma.

orgreference.text: Castro-Rodríguez JA, et al. A clinical index to define risk of asthma in young children with recurrent wheezing. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2000; 162: 1403–1406.

other_refer.text: Leonardi NA, et al. Validation of the Asthma Predictive Index and comparison with simpler clinical prediction rules. J Allergy Clin Immunol. 2011 Jun;127(6):1466-72.e6.

data.evidence:
Strict Criteria:

  • ≥3 episodes of wheezing per year, AND
  • ≥1 major criteria OR ≥2 minor criteria

Loose Criteria:

  • <3 episodes of wheezing per year, AND
  • ≥1 major criteria OR ≥2 minor criteria
data.facts:
In the derivation study:

  • 59% of children with a positive loose index had active asthma at school age (defined at 15 years).
  • 76% of those with a positive strict index had active asthma at school age (defined at 15 years).
